lessons.name: Alan, Delal, Sosîn, Azad
lessons.subtitle: Character Profiles
lessons.learningObjective: Read short character descriptions in present tense and answer comprehension questions

lines.ku: Navê min Alan e.
lines.en: My name is Alan.

lines.ku: Ez deh salî me.
lines.en: I am 10 years old.

lines.ku: Ez diçim malê.
lines.en: I go home.

lines.ku: Ez sêvê dixwim, lê goşt naxwim.
lines.en: I eat the apple, but I don't eat meat.

lines.ku: Ez li Wanê dimînim.
lines.en: I live in Van.

lines.ku: Navê min Delal e. Ez bîst salî me.
lines.en: My name is Delal. I am 20 years old.

lines.ku: Ez masî difroşim, lê lîmonê dikirim.
lines.en: I sell fish, but I buy lemons.

lines.ku: Ez li Mêrdînê dimînim.
lines.en: I live in Mardin.

lines.ku: Navê wê Sosîn e. Ew yanzdeh salî ye.
lines.en: Her name is Sosîn. She is 11 years old.

lines.ku: Ew şagirt e. Ew diçe xwendegehê.
lines.en: She is a student. She goes to school.

lines.ku: Ew pirtûkê dixwîne.
lines.en: She reads the book.

activities.explanation: Alan says "goşt naxwim" — he does NOT eat meat. "na-" before the verb stem makes it negative.
Sosîn is a student (şagirt) and goes to school (diçe xwendegehê). She also reads books (pirtûkê dixwîne).
Delal says "Ez li Mêrdînê dimînim" — I live in Mardin.

activities.instruction: Complete: Alan sêvê ..., lê goşt naxwe.
activities.explanation: "dixwe" = eats. The verb xwarin (to eat) → dixwe (he/she eats). Don't confuse with dixwîne (reads) from xwendin.

activities.instruction: Match each character with what they do

lessons.name: Kesandina Lêkeran
lessons.subtitle: Verb Conjugation
lessons.learningObjective: Learn present tense conjugation of key Kurdish verbs using the di-[stem]-[ending] pattern

activities.example: Ez diçim malê. Tu diçî ku?
activities.exampleTranslation: I go home. Where do you go?

activities.example: Ez sêvê dixwim. Ew goşt dixwe.
activities.exampleTranslation: I eat the apple. He/she eats meat.
I say. What do you say?

lines.ku: ez diçim / tu diçî / ew diçe
lines.en: I go / you go / he-she goes

lines.ku: em diçin / hûn diçin / ew diçin
lines.en: we go / you (pl.) go / they go

lines.ku: ez dixwim / tu dixwî / ew dixwe
lines.en: I eat / you eat / he-she eats

lines.ku: ez dibînim / tu dibînî / ew dibîne
lines.en: I see / you see / he-she sees

lines.ku: ez dizanim / tu dizanî / ew dizane
lines.en: I know / you know / he-she knows

activities.explanation: For "ez" (I), the present tense ending is -im: di-xw-im → dixwim.
For "tu" (you), the ending is -î: di-bêj-î → dibêjî. The verb gotin changes its stem to bêj- in present tense.
For "ew" (he/she), the ending is -e: di-xwîn-e → dixwîne.

activities.instruction: Match the infinitive to its imperative form
Match the verb to its meaning
What is the present tense pattern for Kurdish verbs?
activities.explanation: Kurdish present tense uses di- prefix + stem + personal ending: di-ç-im (I go), di-xw-î (you eat), di-bîn-e (he/she sees). The bi- prefix is for imperative (commands).

lessons.name: Tewandîn
lessons.subtitle: Accusative Case
lessons.learningObjective: Learn the accusative case: feminine nouns add -ê, masculine nouns stay the same

activities.translation: Feminine nouns add -ê, masculine nouns stay the same
activities.example: Ez jinê dibînim. Ez mêr dibînim.
activities.exampleTranslation: I see the woman (fem→-ê). I see the man (masc→no change).

activities.example: Sêv sor e. Ez sêvê dixwim.
activities.exampleTranslation: The apple is red. I eat the apple.

activities.example: Nan erzan e. Tu nan dixwî.
activities.exampleTranslation: Bread is cheap. You eat bread.

lines.ku: Mêr dîn e. → Ez mêr dibînim.
lines.en: The man is crazy. → I see the man. (masc: no change)

lines.ku: Jin dîn e. → Ez jinê dibînim.
lines.en: The woman is crazy. → I see the woman. (fem: +ê)

lines.ku: Sêv sor e. → Ez sêvê dixwim.
lines.en: The apple is red. → I eat the apple. (fem: +ê)

lines.ku: Nan erzan e. → Tu nan dixwî.
lines.en: Bread is cheap. → You eat bread. (masc: no change)

lines.ku: Pirtûk nû ye. → Ez pirtûkê dixwînim.
lines.en: The book is new. → I read the book. (fem: +ê)

lines.ku: Xanî sor e. → Ez xanî dibînim.
lines.en: The house is red. → I see the house. (masc: no change)

activities.instruction: "Ez ___ dixwim." Which is correct for sêv (feminine)?
activities.explanation: Sêv is feminine. In the accusative case, feminine nouns add -ê: sêv → sêvê. "Ez sêvê dixwim" = I eat the apple.

activities.instruction: "Tu ___ dixwî." Which is correct for nan (masculine)?
activities.explanation: Nan is masculine. Masculine nouns do NOT change in the accusative case. "Tu nan dixwî" = You eat bread.
Jîrfon (smartphone) is feminine. In the accusative: jîrfon → jîrfonê. "Tu jîrfonê dikirî" = You buy the smartphone.
Xanî (house) is masculine. Masculine nouns stay the same in accusative. "Ez xanî dibînim" = I see the house.

lessons.name: Diyalog
lessons.subtitle: Meeting Dialogue
lessons.learningObjective: Practice a meeting dialogue — asking about origin, occupation, age, and languages

wordsLearned.ku: Ez bîst û pênc salî me.

activities.example: Tu ji ku yî? — Ez ji Wanê me.
activities.exampleTranslation: Where are you from? — I am from Van.

activities.example: Tu çi dikî? — Ez xwendekar im.
activities.exampleTranslation: What do you do? — I am a student.

activities.example: Tu çend salî yî? — Ez nozdeh salî me.
activities.exampleTranslation: How old are you? — I am 19 years old.

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Silav! Tu çawa yî?
lines.en: Hello! How are you?

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Silav! Ez baş im. Tu çawa yî?
lines.en: Hello! I am good. How are you?

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Ez baş im. Tu ji ku tê?
lines.en: I am good. Where are you coming from?

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Ez ji zanîngehê têm.
lines.en: I am coming from the university.

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Tu çi dikî?
lines.en: What do you do?

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Ez xwendekar im.
lines.en: I am a university student.

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Gelo tu ji ku yî?
lines.en: So, where are you from?

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Ez ji Iranê me. Tu farsî dizanî?
lines.en: I am from Iran. Do you know Farsi?

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Na, ez farsî nizanim. Ez kurd im, ez ji Wanê me.
lines.en: No, I don't know Farsi. I am Kurdish, I am from Van.

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Berfîn navê kurdî ye. Tu çend salî yî?
lines.en: Berfîn is a Kurdish name. How old are you?

lines.speaker: Berfîn
lines.ku: Ez bîst û pênc salî me. Tu çend salî yî?
lines.en: I am 25 years old. How old are you?

lines.speaker: Dîlan
lines.ku: Ez nozdeh salî me.
lines.en: I am 19 years old.

activities.explanation: Dîlan says "Ez ji zanîngehê têm" — I am coming from the university. zanîngeh = university.
Berfîn says "Na, ez farsî nizanim" — No, I don't know Farsi. Note the negation: dizanim → nizanim (zanîn uses ni- for negation).

activities.before: Tu ji ku yî? — Ez ji
activities.display: Tu ji ku yî? — Ez ji ___ me.
activities.explanation: City names in Kurdish take -ê in the oblique case: Wan → Wanê. "Ez ji Wanê me" = I am from Van.
"Tu çend salî yî?" = How old are you? Literally: You how many years-old are? salî = years old.
